context:
Program Name: Concept Art for Entertainment
Code: G407
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 year (3 semesters)
Starting Months: September
Domestic Tuition: $11,781.00
International Tuition: $30,245.00
Location: Waterfront Campus
Program Description: Concept art is critical in conceptualizing and driving the production process of video games and film. In this rigorous one-year graduate certificate program, students will expand their techniques and creativity to transform written ideas into visual experiences. The intensive curriculum provides specialized skills for graduates of the Game - Art, Interaction Design, and Graphic Design programs. Students will learn production processes, art styles, and drawing techniques while assembling a personal portfolio and directing art production for games and film. In semester 3, students with approved portfolios are eligible for non-mandatory external field placements.
Credential Type: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Duration: 1 year (3 semesters)
Starting Months: September
Domestic Tuition Fee: $11,781.00
International Tuition Fee: $30,245.00
Location: Waterfront Campus
Program Availability:
- Fall 2024: Open for domestic and international students
- Winter 2025: Not Available for domestic and international students
- Spring 2025: Not Available for domestic and international students
Related Programs: Graphic Design (G102), Art and Design Foundation (G108), Design Management (Postgraduate) (G401)

Program: Bachelor of Fine Arts or diploma/advanced diploma in game, graphics or arts field
Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition (3 semesters starting Fall 2023): $11,781.00 *
- International Tuition (3 semesters starting Fall 2024): $30,245.00 **
Additional Costs: Estimated total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees
- Domestic Students (3 semesters starting Fall 2023): Amounts listed are the estimated total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees
- International Students (3 semesters starting Fall 2024): Amounts listed are the estimated total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees
- Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates.
Admission Requirements:
- Bachelor of Fine Arts or diploma/advanced diploma in game, graphics or arts field
- Online interview*
- Resumé*
- Portfolio* (digital portfolio accepted)
- Applicant questionnaire*
- Qualified applicants will be invited to complete the application questionnaire and submit a portfolio and resumé electronically. Details on these supplementary requirements will be communicated at a later date to qualified applicants, as part of the review process.
- Qualified applicants may also be invited for an interview.
English Language Proficiency: Applicants with international transcripts who do not provide English proficiency test results must test at the college level in the George Brown College English assessment to be considered for admission.
Course Exemptions: College or university credits may qualify you for course exemptions. Please visit the Transfer Guide for more information.

*Note: The asterisk (*) denotes required documents/steps for applying to the program.

The text provides information about applying to George Brown College, specifically for the Game Development Program at the School of Design. It mentions several ways to get in touch with the program, including phone numbers and email addresses. It also specifies that international students should apply through a different application system than domestic students. The text also provides information about the location of the School of Design, with two campus addresses: 230 Richmond St. E. and Toronto, Ontario, Canada, M5A 1L1, and 3 Lower Jarvis St., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The text also mentions several labs and facilities available at the School of Design building, such as a virtual and augmented reality lab, usability and testing lab, Future Ways of Living lab, peer tutor lab, digital sandbox, incubators, prototyping and workshop spaces, and design and innovation showcase spaces. The text also mentions several related programs offered by the college: Graphic Design (G102), Art and Design Foundation (G108), and Design Management (Postgraduate) (G401). Finally, it encourages readers to attend information sessions or book a campus tour for more information about the program.

Extracted Information:
- George Brown College Game Development Program
- School of Design contact information: 416-415-5000, ext. 3129 (phone), game@georgebrown.ca (email)
- Jean-Paul Amore, Game Development Program Co-ordinator: ext. 3427 or jamore@georgebrown.ca
- Domestic students apply through Ontario Colleges, international students apply through the George Brown College Online Application System
- School of Design locations: 230 Richmond St. E., Toronto, Ontario, Canada, M5A 1L1 and 3 Lower Jarvis St., Toronto, Ontario, Canada
- Facilities at School of Design building: virtual and augmented reality lab, usability and testing lab, Future Ways of Living lab, peer tutor lab, digital sandbox, incubators, prototyping and workshop spaces, design and innovation showcase spaces
- Related programs offered by George Brown College: Graphic Design (G102), Art and Design Foundation (G108), Design Management (Postgraduate) (G401)

- Information sessions and campus tours available.
